results.byline: By Mario Koran and Jamie Kelter Davis
results.title: Inside a ‘Nightmare’ Lockdown at a Wisconsin Prison
results.abstract: Inmates who have been confined mostly to their cells for more than four months describe unsanitary conditions and a dearth of medical care. Experts say dire staffing shortages are likely to blame and are leading to lockdowns across the country.

media.caption: Waupun Correctional Institution in southeast Wisconsin has been locked down since March. Prison officials have not said when normal operations will resume.
